intro: Satyrium nepalense var. ciliatum, commonly known as the Nepal satyrium, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique and delicate floral structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or on rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually small, with intricate patterns and a distinctive coloration that aids in pollination by specific insect species. This variant is distinguished by its finely ciliate (fringed) margins on the petals and sepals, contributing to its ornamental value and ecological significance.
